Staying in this beautifully converted 1904 refrigerator boxcar was an exceptional experience, offering a stunning view of Amarillo's plains from the comfort of a modernized, rustic interior. The indulgence of a hot tub under the expansive Texas sky, both day and night, was a true highlight. The shower room stands out, with its original refrigerator wall and floor that retain the boxcar's historical charm.
There are two minor points to note about the shower room: firstly, managing the levers to adjust the shower temperature can be a bit tricky, and secondly, the stylish custom-made shower head delivers a straight downward pour, which might not suit you if you prefer to keep your hair dry. Despite these nuances, the boxcar's charm and uniqueness make it an essential destination for anyone in search of a retreat that's far from the ordinary.

review_text:
The Canyon Casita is an awesome place to stay and the hosts are wonderful. The pictures are fairly accurate but do not fully do it justice. Although it is a converted garage office/building, it is not noticeable and is extremely comfortable. Additionally, while it is next to the hosts' house, it is on the garage side and separated from view - so privacy is not a concern. The location is in a small subdivisions with several houses nearby, but not too close, and loud gatherings in the evening or night might not be appropriate.
The decor is definitely panhandle Texas and well done. The casita was extremely clean and well kept. The furnishing are higher quality and comfortable. We easily slept five (two adults and our three adult children) and would have had no problem sleeping six. The rental is well stocked and has everything needed (washer/dryer, towels, dishes, cooking pots/utensils, etc), plus some, to make the stay more comfortable. While there is only one bathroom, it is quite large and well laid out. There is a small area in front of the casita that is fenced in with a swing, several chairs, and a fire pit that we found very relaxing.
The location of the casita is a bit remote from Amarillo (15-20 mins), but was close to Canyon. There is a Walmart and convenience store within 5-10 minutes if supplies are needed - so easily accessible. Canyon is a relatively small town, but does have a few restaurants and fast food spots. We found the area around the town square to be enjoyable. If going to Palo Duro, it is a bit further (25-30 mins) and is a bit of a "hike". The location of the Canyon Casita actually worked out well as we went to Palo Duro several times.
The hosts are pleasant and accommodating. We really had no issues that needed to be addressed, so I cannot comment on their timeliness in addressing the same. They were, however, quick to respond to messages prior to our booking and before checking in - so I do believe that they would have been quick to respond to any concerns. Despite living next to the casita, the hosts were not intrusive and seemed to make it a point not to be bothersome. We did get a chance to meet them, as we crossed paths in the driveway, and found them to very friendly and gracious.
We were extremely pleased with our stay at the Canyon Casita and its hosts. We would definitely look to book it again should we return to the area.
